pull_request.title: Add support for updating Multiline Plain Text Content Controls
pull_request.body:
This will update Structured Document Tags (aka Content Controls) of type plain text and the `multiLine` property with multiple lines of text, separated by line breaks, if the input value string contains newlines.

For reference, the contents of an SDT usually look something like this:

```xml
      <w:sdtContent>
        <w:p>

          <w:r>
            <w:rPr>          <!-- Run formatting  -->
              <w:b/>
              <w:bCs/>
            </w:rPr>
            <w:t>Foo</w:t>
            <w:br />          <!-- Line Break  -->
            <w:t>Bar</w:t>
          </w:r>

          <w:r>
            <w:rPr>
              <!-- Same formatting as first run -->
            </w:rPr>
            <w:t>...</w:t>
          </w:r>

        </w:p>
      </w:sdtContent>
```

This PR changes the approach how SDTs are updated. Previously, the first `<w:t />` node was located, and then mutated (it's `text` property was updated). After that, all other text nodes and runs were discarded.

The new approach in this PR keeps the first run (with its associated formatting, unless its formatting for a placeholder), discards all others, and then empties that first run. Then new text nodes (and `<w:br />` nodes) are **constructed** inside that run.

This allows us to use a more straightforward approach to update the content (creating fresh nodes instead of fiddling in an existing structure).

---

For regular (non-multiline) plain text content controls (which were already supported), this approach should behave the same as before, with one exception:

Depending on how Word ripped apart the runs during formatting, it might apply `xml:space="preserve"` to text nodes to preserve leading/trailing whitespace at boundaries. (That whitespace would otherwise fall victim to whitespace collapsing).

This `xml:space="preserve"` attribute will not be retained by the new approach. This is why the `content_controls.docx` in the fixture for the existing test had to be updated. However, since we're constructing new, clean nodes, and won't produce fragmented text, this shouldn't matter in my opinion.

For [CA-5079](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-5079)

SchemaMigration: Add create_index_if_not_exists() helper method:

This method allows us to only emit CREATE INDEX statements if the index doesn't
exist yet, which makes it easier to write idempotent upgrade steps.
Use create_index_if_not_exists() for recent upgrade steps that create indexes.

SchemaMigration: Remove obsolete handling for MySQL:

This removes the IdempotentOperations class and some other special handling
for MySQL, which we have dropped support for years ago and isn't used anywhere
anymore (production or otherwise).

Merge pull request #7630 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-5038/has-index

Fix upgrade steps that add new indexes

pull_request.title: Fix upgrade steps that add new indexes
pull_request.body:
This introduces a new helper method `.create_index_if_not_exists()` on the `SchemaMigration` class that will only emit a `CREATE INDEX` statement if the index by that name doesn't exist yet, and makes the (recent) upgrade steps that add new indexes use it.

This makes those upgrade steps idempotent, so that they won't fail if executed a second time.

In addition, I removed the `IdempotentOperations` class and some other special handling for MySQL, which we dropped support for years ago.

For [CA-5038](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-5038)

## Checklist

- [x] Changelog entry
- [x] Link to issue (Jira or GitHub) and backlink in issue (Jira)

comment.body:
There's no easy way to adapt Document and Dossier at the same time (since they don't share a common interface that's not also shared by something else). A _named_ adapter would muddle the concept of a `DocPropertyProvider` even more than it already is, IMHO. Not a fan of that.

But remember: You don't need an interface in order to register an adapter for something. You can also register an adapter for a plain Python class, like `PropertySheetSchemaDefinition`, and then it will be found when you query for an adapter with an object that is an instance of `PropertySheetSchemaDefinition`. @tinagerber maybe that helps?

pull_request.title: Revoke roles when objects are removed from a task's related items.
pull_request.body:
Local roles are added on documents that are related to a task. When closing that task, the local roles are revoked on the current list of related items, but if some objects were removed from the list of related items at some point, the local roles on these documents would never get revoked.
For newly added related items, the local roles were correctly updated in an event handler. To revoke the local roles on related items that get removed, we need to find out which objects were removed from the list of related items. This information is not accessible in the event handler, so we had to store the list of related items in the annotations on each task, allowing us to compare it with the `relatedItems` field on the task and revoking the local roles accordingly.

For [CA-5006]

pull_request.title: Make OGDS sync case insensitive
pull_request.body:
This makes the OGDS synchronisation case inensitive with regard to the user ID.

Therefore, when a user ID changes case in LDAP/AP, it will still be matched to the existing OGDS user (with original capitalization for its user ID) when updating user properties and group memberships.

For [CA-4834](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-4834)

- [x] Changelog entry
- [x] Link to issue (Jira or GitHub) and backlink in issue (Jira)

pull_request.title: Make OGDS sync case insensitive
pull_request.body:
This makes the OGDS synchronisation case inensitive with regard to the user ID.

Therefore, when a user ID changes case in LDAP/AP, it will still be matched to the existing OGDS user (with original capitalization for its user ID) when updating user properties and group memberships.

issue.title: Site Administrator can't access user controlpanel
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
A user with the Site Administrator role, receives an Unauthorized error, when trying to access the user's controlpanel:

http://localhost:3000/controlpanel/users

Log:

```bash
2022-11-18 10:24:33 ERROR [Zope.SiteErrorLog:35][waitress-2] Unauthorized: http://localhost:3000/@roles
Traceback (innermost last):
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 167, in transaction_pubevents
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 376, in publish_module
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 255, in publish
  Module ZPublisher.BaseRequest, line 641, in traverse
  Module ZPublisher.HTTPResponse, line 1017, in unauthorized
zExceptions.unauthorized.Unauthorized: You are not authorized to access this resource.
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Create a user with the Site Administrator role
2. Logged in with this user, try to access the user's controlpanel:
http://localhost:3000/controlpanel/users

**Expected behavior**
Allow the user to access the control panel

**Software (please complete the following information):**

OS: Ubuntu 22
Browser: Chrome
Volto Version: 16.0.0-alpha.48
Plone Version 6.0.0b3
Plone REST API Version: 8.30.0

commits.message:
Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL:

This view allows 3rd party applications to produce links that should directly
trigger a checkout using OfficeConnector on a GEVER document.

In case a necessary precondition is not satisfied (e.g., document is already
checked out by someone else), the view just redirects to the regular document
view, which should give the user some indication as to why the checkout didn't
work.

Merge pull request #7615 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-4900/oc-launch-browser-view

Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL

pull_request.title: Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL
pull_request.body:
This view allows 3rd party applications to produce links that should directly trigger a checkout using OfficeConnector on a GEVER document.

In case a necessary precondition is not satisfied (e.g., document is already checked out by someone else), the view just redirects to the regular document view, which should give the user some indication as to why the checkout didn't work.

> **Note**: This registers a browser view with the same same as the [existing `oc_checkout` REST API endpoint](https://github.com/4teamwork/opengever.core/blob/d7ee0559ca3989fba3a55ded972f623acb585adc/opengever/officeconnector/configure.zcml#L70-L77).
> This technically isn't a problem, because one is a REST service and the other a Browser View (`plone.rest` can distingiush those via content negotiation), one is on the Site Root and the other only on documents, and one is POST while the other one is GET.
> Just thought I'd point it out.

Refactor transition guard for 'task-transition-planned-open'

Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress:

This prevents subtasks in a subprocess to be started manually by the user
unless the containing parent task is already in progress. This avoids getting
the task structure into a state where the logic to automatically start the
next task fails. That logic assumes that the next task to be started is in a
'planned' state, and trips up if it has already been started manually.

Merge pull request #7614 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-4945

Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress

pull_request.title: Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress
pull_request.body:
In a nested task structure that contains a sequential subprocess, it was possible to manually start a subtask inside such a subprocess even though the containing parent task was still in the planned state.

This lead to an invalid task structure, causing the logic that is supposed start the next task when a task is closed to trip up, because it doesn't expect the next task to be already in progress.

Sentry: https://sentry.4teamwork.ch/organizations/sentry/issues/98191/

pull_request.title: Return an active-flag for available roles in in the `@participations endpoint.
pull_request.body:
This PR extends the `available_roles` items of the `@participations` endpoint with an `active` flag for each available role.

The flag will be set to `false` if the registry entry: `opengever.dossier.interfaces.IDossierParticipants.roles` is used and the given role is not listed in the list of roles.

This flag is required for the ui to know if a specific role is selectable or not. Just remove these roles is not possible because we need the inactive items for the `title` lookup for already existing entries.

pull_request.title: OfficeConnector cancel checkout
pull_request.body:
Track if a document has pending changes and include this info in the checkout metadata for Office Connector.

We want to know if a document was modified since the last checkout and if there are changes that haven't been checked in yet. Unfortunately we can not determine this directly as Word documents are always modified on checkout and checkin because of DocProperties updates. Even if this is not the case, it's hard to determine if a document was really modified. We would have to diff the file contents of the current working copy with the last version. Therefore we add a marker when a new document version gets uploaded.

Requires a new Office Connector version (>1.16.0) to get the feature working, but older versions still work as before.
See: https://github.com/4teamwork/OfficeConnector/pull/392

For [CA-3864](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-3864)

commits.message: Add copy_dossier_to_workspace action

Add `@prepare-copy-dossier-to-workspace` endpoint:

This API endpoint is used to prepare copying a dossier to a linked workspace.

It operates in two modes: Validation, or preparing an empty folder structure on
the teamraum side to upload documents to.

In validation mode, it checks that the given structure (subdossier(s) and
documents) satisfies all the constraints to be copied to a workspace. If not,
a detailed list of errors by object is returned.

In "prepare structure" mode, it will mirror the structure of the given
subdossier to teamraum by creating empty folders in the workspace, and
returning a list of documents, including their target folders that the client
should then upload them to.

The second stage ("prepare structure") does not perform validation again. It
assumes that the client validated the structure beforehand, and either
everything is ok, or the user selected "copy anyway", in which case some
individual document uploads will fail.

@copy-document-to-workspace: Also allow copying documents to workspace folders:

If a folder_uid is given, a document may now also be copied to the respective
workspace folder, instead of the workspace root. In order to accomplish this,
the `@upload-document-copy` endpoint now is also available on workspace folders.

OpengeverFixtureWithSolr: Isolate Solr data between tests:

In order to properly isolate Solr between tests, the data needs to be restored
to the 'fixture' backup that was created on layer setup.

Testing: Use PORT2 instead of PORT5 for Solr during tests:

The docker service layers that were added (msgconvert, weasyprint, etc..)
use ports 5-8 for their docker containers. Because Solr already uses PORT5
as well, this leads to occasional port conflicts on Jenkins.

Because the ports for the service layers are a nice sequence, we change the
Solr port instead (to PORT2, which is currently unused).

Testing: Make sure layer names don't start with the name of another layer:

The --layer flag of collective.xmltestreport / zope.testrunner greedily matches
layer names by default.

For this reason, when a layer name starts with a prefix that is itself the name
of another layer, we run into issues with bin/mtest because tests on that
layer will be run multiple times, may not be excluded as expected or may run
in parallel even though they shouldn't.
Add a functional Solr ZServer layer and base linked workspace tests on it.
Add tests for `@prepare-copy-dossier-to-workspace` endpoint.
Update API docs.
Change error format to closer resemble our standard error format.

pull_request.title: Add support for updating Multiline Plain Text Content Controls
pull_request.body:
This will update Structured Document Tags (aka Content Controls) of type plain text and the `multiLine` property with multiple lines of text, separated by line breaks, if the input value string contains newlines.

For reference, the contents of an SDT usually look something like this:

```xml
      <w:sdtContent>
        <w:p>

          <w:r>
            <w:rPr>          <!-- Run formatting  -->
              <w:b/>
              <w:bCs/>
            </w:rPr>
            <w:t>Foo</w:t>
            <w:br />          <!-- Line Break  -->
            <w:t>Bar</w:t>
          </w:r>

          <w:r>
            <w:rPr>
              <!-- Same formatting as first run -->
            </w:rPr>
            <w:t>...</w:t>
          </w:r>

        </w:p>
      </w:sdtContent>
```

This PR changes the approach how SDTs are updated. Previously, the first `<w:t />` node was located, and then mutated (it's `text` property was updated). After that, all other text nodes and runs were discarded.

The new approach in this PR keeps the first run (with its associated formatting, unless its formatting for a placeholder), discards all others, and then empties that first run. Then new text nodes (and `<w:br />` nodes) are **constructed** inside that run.

This allows us to use a more straightforward approach to update the content (creating fresh nodes instead of fiddling in an existing structure).

---

For regular (non-multiline) plain text content controls (which were already supported), this approach should behave the same as before, with one exception:

Depending on how Word ripped apart the runs during formatting, it might apply `xml:space="preserve"` to text nodes to preserve leading/trailing whitespace at boundaries. (That whitespace would otherwise fall victim to whitespace collapsing).

This `xml:space="preserve"` attribute will not be retained by the new approach. This is why the `content_controls.docx` in the fixture for the existing test had to be updated. However, since we're constructing new, clean nodes, and won't produce fragmented text, this shouldn't matter in my opinion.

For [CA-5079](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-5079)

SchemaMigration: Add create_index_if_not_exists() helper method:

This method allows us to only emit CREATE INDEX statements if the index doesn't
exist yet, which makes it easier to write idempotent upgrade steps.
Use create_index_if_not_exists() for recent upgrade steps that create indexes.

SchemaMigration: Remove obsolete handling for MySQL:

This removes the IdempotentOperations class and some other special handling
for MySQL, which we have dropped support for years ago and isn't used anywhere
anymore (production or otherwise).

Merge pull request #7630 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-5038/has-index

Fix upgrade steps that add new indexes

pull_request.title: Fix upgrade steps that add new indexes
pull_request.body:
This introduces a new helper method `.create_index_if_not_exists()` on the `SchemaMigration` class that will only emit a `CREATE INDEX` statement if the index by that name doesn't exist yet, and makes the (recent) upgrade steps that add new indexes use it.

This makes those upgrade steps idempotent, so that they won't fail if executed a second time.

In addition, I removed the `IdempotentOperations` class and some other special handling for MySQL, which we dropped support for years ago.

For [CA-5038](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-5038)

- [x] Link to issue (Jira or GitHub) and backlink in issue (Jira)

comment.body:
There's no easy way to adapt Document and Dossier at the same time (since they don't share a common interface that's not also shared by something else). A _named_ adapter would muddle the concept of a `DocPropertyProvider` even more than it already is, IMHO. Not a fan of that.

But remember: You don't need an interface in order to register an adapter for something. You can also register an adapter for a plain Python class, like `PropertySheetSchemaDefinition`, and then it will be found when you query for an adapter with an object that is an instance of `PropertySheetSchemaDefinition`. @tinagerber maybe that helps?

pull_request.title: Revoke roles when objects are removed from a task's related items.
pull_request.body:
Local roles are added on documents that are related to a task. When closing that task, the local roles are revoked on the current list of related items, but if some objects were removed from the list of related items at some point, the local roles on these documents would never get revoked.
For newly added related items, the local roles were correctly updated in an event handler. To revoke the local roles on related items that get removed, we need to find out which objects were removed from the list of related items. This information is not accessible in the event handler, so we had to store the list of related items in the annotations on each task, allowing us to compare it with the `relatedItems` field on the task and revoking the local roles accordingly.

For [CA-5006]

pull_request.title: Make OGDS sync case insensitive
pull_request.body:
This makes the OGDS synchronisation case inensitive with regard to the user ID.

Therefore, when a user ID changes case in LDAP/AP, it will still be matched to the existing OGDS user (with original capitalization for its user ID) when updating user properties and group memberships.

pull_request.title: Make OGDS sync case insensitive
pull_request.body:
This makes the OGDS synchronisation case inensitive with regard to the user ID.

Therefore, when a user ID changes case in LDAP/AP, it will still be matched to the existing OGDS user (with original capitalization for its user ID) when updating user properties and group memberships.

issue.title: Site Administrator can't access user controlpanel
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
A user with the Site Administrator role, receives an Unauthorized error, when trying to access the user's controlpanel:

http://localhost:3000/controlpanel/users

Log:

```bash
2022-11-18 10:24:33 ERROR [Zope.SiteErrorLog:35][waitress-2] Unauthorized: http://localhost:3000/@roles
Traceback (innermost last):
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 167, in transaction_pubevents
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 376, in publish_module
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 255, in publish
  Module ZPublisher.BaseRequest, line 641, in traverse
  Module ZPublisher.HTTPResponse, line 1017, in unauthorized
zExceptions.unauthorized.Unauthorized: You are not authorized to access this resource.
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Create a user with the Site Administrator role
2. Logged in with this user, try to access the user's controlpanel:
http://localhost:3000/controlpanel/users

**Expected behavior**
Allow the user to access the control panel

**Software (please complete the following information):**

OS: Ubuntu 22
Browser: Chrome
Volto Version: 16.0.0-alpha.48
Plone Version 6.0.0b3
Plone REST API Version: 8.30.0

commits.message:
Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL:

This view allows 3rd party applications to produce links that should directly
trigger a checkout using OfficeConnector on a GEVER document.

In case a necessary precondition is not satisfied (e.g., document is already
checked out by someone else), the view just redirects to the regular document
view, which should give the user some indication as to why the checkout didn't
work.

Merge pull request #7615 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-4900/oc-launch-browser-view

Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL

pull_request.title: Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL
pull_request.body:
This view allows 3rd party applications to produce links that should directly trigger a checkout using OfficeConnector on a GEVER document.

In case a necessary precondition is not satisfied (e.g., document is already checked out by someone else), the view just redirects to the regular document view, which should give the user some indication as to why the checkout didn't work.

> **Note**: This registers a browser view with the same same as the [existing `oc_checkout` REST API endpoint](https://github.com/4teamwork/opengever.core/blob/d7ee0559ca3989fba3a55ded972f623acb585adc/opengever/officeconnector/configure.zcml#L70-L77).
> This technically isn't a problem, because one is a REST service and the other a Browser View (`plone.rest` can distingiush those via content negotiation), one is on the Site Root and the other only on documents, and one is POST while the other one is GET.
> Just thought I'd point it out.

For [CA-4900](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-4900)

Refactor transition guard for 'task-transition-planned-open'

Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress:

This prevents subtasks in a subprocess to be started manually by the user
unless the containing parent task is already in progress. This avoids getting
the task structure into a state where the logic to automatically start the
next task fails. That logic assumes that the next task to be started is in a
'planned' state, and trips up if it has already been started manually.

Merge pull request #7614 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-4945

Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress

pull_request.title: Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress
pull_request.body:
In a nested task structure that contains a sequential subprocess, it was possible to manually start a subtask inside such a subprocess even though the containing parent task was still in the planned state.

This lead to an invalid task structure, causing the logic that is supposed start the next task when a task is closed to trip up, because it doesn't expect the next task to be already in progress.

Sentry: https://sentry.4teamwork.ch/organizations/sentry/issues/98191/

For [CA-4945](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-4945)

 - [x] Resolved any Sentry issues caused by this bug

pull_request.title: Return an active-flag for available roles in in the `@participations endpoint.
pull_request.body:
This PR extends the `available_roles` items of the `@participations` endpoint with an `active` flag for each available role.

The flag will be set to `false` if the registry entry: `opengever.dossier.interfaces.IDossierParticipants.roles` is used and the given role is not listed in the list of roles.

This flag is required for the ui to know if a specific role is selectable or not. Just remove these roles is not possible because we need the inactive items for the `title` lookup for already existing entries.

pull_request.title: OfficeConnector cancel checkout
pull_request.body:
Track if a document has pending changes and include this info in the checkout metadata for Office Connector.

We want to know if a document was modified since the last checkout and if there are changes that haven't been checked in yet. Unfortunately we can not determine this directly as Word documents are always modified on checkout and checkin because of DocProperties updates. Even if this is not the case, it's hard to determine if a document was really modified. We would have to diff the file contents of the current working copy with the last version. Therefore we add a marker when a new document version gets uploaded.

Requires a new Office Connector version (>1.16.0) to get the feature working, but older versions still work as before.
See: https://github.com/4teamwork/OfficeConnector/pull/392

commits.message: Add copy_dossier_to_workspace action

Add `@prepare-copy-dossier-to-workspace` endpoint:

This API endpoint is used to prepare copying a dossier to a linked workspace.

It operates in two modes: Validation, or preparing an empty folder structure on
the teamraum side to upload documents to.

In validation mode, it checks that the given structure (subdossier(s) and
documents) satisfies all the constraints to be copied to a workspace. If not,
a detailed list of errors by object is returned.

In "prepare structure" mode, it will mirror the structure of the given
subdossier to teamraum by creating empty folders in the workspace, and
returning a list of documents, including their target folders that the client
should then upload them to.

The second stage ("prepare structure") does not perform validation again. It
assumes that the client validated the structure beforehand, and either
everything is ok, or the user selected "copy anyway", in which case some
individual document uploads will fail.

@copy-document-to-workspace: Also allow copying documents to workspace folders:

If a folder_uid is given, a document may now also be copied to the respective
workspace folder, instead of the workspace root. In order to accomplish this,
the `@upload-document-copy` endpoint now is also available on workspace folders.

OpengeverFixtureWithSolr: Isolate Solr data between tests:

In order to properly isolate Solr between tests, the data needs to be restored
to the 'fixture' backup that was created on layer setup.

Testing: Use PORT2 instead of PORT5 for Solr during tests:

The docker service layers that were added (msgconvert, weasyprint, etc..)
use ports 5-8 for their docker containers. Because Solr already uses PORT5
as well, this leads to occasional port conflicts on Jenkins.

Because the ports for the service layers are a nice sequence, we change the
Solr port instead (to PORT2, which is currently unused).

Testing: Make sure layer names don't start with the name of another layer:

The --layer flag of collective.xmltestreport / zope.testrunner greedily matches
layer names by default.

For this reason, when a layer name starts with a prefix that is itself the name
of another layer, we run into issues with bin/mtest because tests on that
layer will be run multiple times, may not be excluded as expected or may run
in parallel even though they shouldn't.
Add a functional Solr ZServer layer and base linked workspace tests on it.
Add tests for `@prepare-copy-dossier-to-workspace` endpoint.
Update API docs.
Change error format to closer resemble our standard error format.

pull_request.title: Add support for updating Multiline Plain Text Content Controls
pull_request.body:
This will update Structured Document Tags (aka Content Controls) of type plain text and the `multiLine` property with multiple lines of text, separated by line breaks, if the input value string contains newlines.

For reference, the contents of an SDT usually look something like this:

```xml
      <w:sdtContent>
        <w:p>

          <w:r>
            <w:rPr>          <!-- Run formatting  -->
              <w:b/>
              <w:bCs/>
            </w:rPr>
            <w:t>Foo</w:t>
            <w:br />          <!-- Line Break  -->
            <w:t>Bar</w:t>
          </w:r>

          <w:r>
            <w:rPr>
              <!-- Same formatting as first run -->
            </w:rPr>
            <w:t>...</w:t>
          </w:r>

        </w:p>
      </w:sdtContent>
```

This PR changes the approach how SDTs are updated. Previously, the first `<w:t />` node was located, and then mutated (it's `text` property was updated). After that, all other text nodes and runs were discarded.

The new approach in this PR keeps the first run (with its associated formatting, unless its formatting for a placeholder), discards all others, and then empties that first run. Then new text nodes (and `<w:br />` nodes) are **constructed** inside that run.

This allows us to use a more straightforward approach to update the content (creating fresh nodes instead of fiddling in an existing structure).

---

For regular (non-multiline) plain text content controls (which were already supported), this approach should behave the same as before, with one exception:

Depending on how Word ripped apart the runs during formatting, it might apply `xml:space="preserve"` to text nodes to preserve leading/trailing whitespace at boundaries. (That whitespace would otherwise fall victim to whitespace collapsing).

This `xml:space="preserve"` attribute will not be retained by the new approach. This is why the `content_controls.docx` in the fixture for the existing test had to be updated. However, since we're constructing new, clean nodes, and won't produce fragmented text, this shouldn't matter in my opinion.

For [CA-5079](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-5079)

SchemaMigration: Add create_index_if_not_exists() helper method:

This method allows us to only emit CREATE INDEX statements if the index doesn't
exist yet, which makes it easier to write idempotent upgrade steps.
Use create_index_if_not_exists() for recent upgrade steps that create indexes.

SchemaMigration: Remove obsolete handling for MySQL:

This removes the IdempotentOperations class and some other special handling
for MySQL, which we have dropped support for years ago and isn't used anywhere
anymore (production or otherwise).

Merge pull request #7630 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-5038/has-index

Fix upgrade steps that add new indexes

pull_request.title: Fix upgrade steps that add new indexes
pull_request.body:
This introduces a new helper method `.create_index_if_not_exists()` on the `SchemaMigration` class that will only emit a `CREATE INDEX` statement if the index by that name doesn't exist yet, and makes the (recent) upgrade steps that add new indexes use it.

This makes those upgrade steps idempotent, so that they won't fail if executed a second time.

In addition, I removed the `IdempotentOperations` class and some other special handling for MySQL, which we dropped support for years ago.

For [CA-5038](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-5038)

comment.body:
There's no easy way to adapt Document and Dossier at the same time (since they don't share a common interface that's not also shared by something else). A _named_ adapter would muddle the concept of a `DocPropertyProvider` even more than it already is, IMHO. Not a fan of that.

But remember: You don't need an interface in order to register an adapter for something. You can also register an adapter for a plain Python class, like `PropertySheetSchemaDefinition`, and then it will be found when you query for an adapter with an object that is an instance of `PropertySheetSchemaDefinition`. @tinagerber maybe that helps?

pull_request.title: Revoke roles when objects are removed from a task's related items.
pull_request.body:
Local roles are added on documents that are related to a task. When closing that task, the local roles are revoked on the current list of related items, but if some objects were removed from the list of related items at some point, the local roles on these documents would never get revoked.
For newly added related items, the local roles were correctly updated in an event handler. To revoke the local roles on related items that get removed, we need to find out which objects were removed from the list of related items. This information is not accessible in the event handler, so we had to store the list of related items in the annotations on each task, allowing us to compare it with the `relatedItems` field on the task and revoking the local roles accordingly.

For [CA-5006]

pull_request.title: Make OGDS sync case insensitive
pull_request.body:
This makes the OGDS synchronisation case inensitive with regard to the user ID.

Therefore, when a user ID changes case in LDAP/AP, it will still be matched to the existing OGDS user (with original capitalization for its user ID) when updating user properties and group memberships.

issue.title: Site Administrator can't access user controlpanel
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
A user with the Site Administrator role, receives an Unauthorized error, when trying to access the user's controlpanel:

http://localhost:3000/controlpanel/users

Log:

```bash
2022-11-18 10:24:33 ERROR [Zope.SiteErrorLog:35][waitress-2] Unauthorized: http://localhost:3000/@roles
Traceback (innermost last):
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 167, in transaction_pubevents
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 376, in publish_module
  Module ZPublisher.WSGIPublisher, line 255, in publish
  Module ZPublisher.BaseRequest, line 641, in traverse
  Module ZPublisher.HTTPResponse, line 1017, in unauthorized
zExceptions.unauthorized.Unauthorized: You are not authorized to access this resource.
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Create a user with the Site Administrator role
2. Logged in with this user, try to access the user's controlpanel:
http://localhost:3000/controlpanel/users

**Expected behavior**
Allow the user to access the control panel

**Software (please complete the following information):**

OS: Ubuntu 22
Browser: Chrome
Volto Version: 16.0.0-alpha.48
Plone Version 6.0.0b3
Plone REST API Version: 8.30.0

commits.message:
Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL:

This view allows 3rd party applications to produce links that should directly
trigger a checkout using OfficeConnector on a GEVER document.

In case a necessary precondition is not satisfied (e.g., document is already
checked out by someone else), the view just redirects to the regular document
view, which should give the user some indication as to why the checkout didn't
work.

Merge pull request #7615 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-4900/oc-launch-browser-view

Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL

pull_request.title: Add `@@oc_checkout` view that redirects to oc: checkout URL
pull_request.body:
This view allows 3rd party applications to produce links that should directly trigger a checkout using OfficeConnector on a GEVER document.

In case a necessary precondition is not satisfied (e.g., document is already checked out by someone else), the view just redirects to the regular document view, which should give the user some indication as to why the checkout didn't work.

> **Note**: This registers a browser view with the same same as the [existing `oc_checkout` REST API endpoint](https://github.com/4teamwork/opengever.core/blob/d7ee0559ca3989fba3a55ded972f623acb585adc/opengever/officeconnector/configure.zcml#L70-L77).
> This technically isn't a problem, because one is a REST service and the other a Browser View (`plone.rest` can distingiush those via content negotiation), one is on the Site Root and the other only on documents, and one is POST while the other one is GET.
> Just thought I'd point it out.

For [CA-4900](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-4900)

- [x] Changelog entry
- [x] Link to issue (Jira or GitHub) and backlink in issue (Jira)

  _No, because mails are not supposed to be checked out_

Refactor transition guard for 'task-transition-planned-open'

Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress:

This prevents subtasks in a subprocess to be started manually by the user
unless the containing parent task is already in progress. This avoids getting
the task structure into a state where the logic to automatically start the
next task fails. That logic assumes that the next task to be started is in a
'planned' state, and trips up if it has already been started manually.

Merge pull request #7614 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-4945

Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress

pull_request.title: Sequential tasks: Only allow subtasks to be started when parent is in progress
pull_request.body:
In a nested task structure that contains a sequential subprocess, it was possible to manually start a subtask inside such a subprocess even though the containing parent task was still in the planned state.

This lead to an invalid task structure, causing the logic that is supposed start the next task when a task is closed to trip up, because it doesn't expect the next task to be already in progress.

Sentry: https://sentry.4teamwork.ch/organizations/sentry/issues/98191/

For [CA-4945](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-4945)

 - [x] Resolved any Sentry issues caused by this bug

pull_request.title: Return an active-flag for available roles in in the `@participations endpoint.
pull_request.body:
This PR extends the `available_roles` items of the `@participations` endpoint with an `active` flag for each available role.

The flag will be set to `false` if the registry entry: `opengever.dossier.interfaces.IDossierParticipants.roles` is used and the given role is not listed in the list of roles.

This flag is required for the ui to know if a specific role is selectable or not. Just remove these roles is not possible because we need the inactive items for the `title` lookup for already existing entries.

pull_request.title: OfficeConnector cancel checkout
pull_request.body:
Track if a document has pending changes and include this info in the checkout metadata for Office Connector.

We want to know if a document was modified since the last checkout and if there are changes that haven't been checked in yet. Unfortunately we can not determine this directly as Word documents are always modified on checkout and checkin because of DocProperties updates. Even if this is not the case, it's hard to determine if a document was really modified. We would have to diff the file contents of the current working copy with the last version. Therefore we add a marker when a new document version gets uploaded.

Requires a new Office Connector version (>1.16.0) to get the feature working, but older versions still work as before.
See: https://github.com/4teamwork/OfficeConnector/pull/392

For [CA-3864](https://4teamwork.atlassian.net/browse/CA-3864)

commits.message: Add copy_dossier_to_workspace action

Add `@prepare-copy-dossier-to-workspace` endpoint:

This API endpoint is used to prepare copying a dossier to a linked workspace.

It operates in two modes: Validation, or preparing an empty folder structure on
the teamraum side to upload documents to.

In validation mode, it checks that the given structure (subdossier(s) and
documents) satisfies all the constraints to be copied to a workspace. If not,
a detailed list of errors by object is returned.

In "prepare structure" mode, it will mirror the structure of the given
subdossier to teamraum by creating empty folders in the workspace, and
returning a list of documents, including their target folders that the client
should then upload them to.

The second stage ("prepare structure") does not perform validation again. It
assumes that the client validated the structure beforehand, and either
everything is ok, or the user selected "copy anyway", in which case some
individual document uploads will fail.

@copy-document-to-workspace: Also allow copying documents to workspace folders:

If a folder_uid is given, a document may now also be copied to the respective
workspace folder, instead of the workspace root. In order to accomplish this,
the `@upload-document-copy` endpoint now is also available on workspace folders.

OpengeverFixtureWithSolr: Isolate Solr data between tests:

In order to properly isolate Solr between tests, the data needs to be restored
to the 'fixture' backup that was created on layer setup.

Testing: Use PORT2 instead of PORT5 for Solr during tests:

The docker service layers that were added (msgconvert, weasyprint, etc..)
use ports 5-8 for their docker containers. Because Solr already uses PORT5
as well, this leads to occasional port conflicts on Jenkins.

Because the ports for the service layers are a nice sequence, we change the
Solr port instead (to PORT2, which is currently unused).

Testing: Make sure layer names don't start with the name of another layer:

The --layer flag of collective.xmltestreport / zope.testrunner greedily matches
layer names by default.

For this reason, when a layer name starts with a prefix that is itself the name
of another layer, we run into issues with bin/mtest because tests on that
layer will be run multiple times, may not be excluded as expected or may run
in parallel even though they shouldn't.
Add a functional Solr ZServer layer and base linked workspace tests on it.
Add tests for `@prepare-copy-dossier-to-workspace` endpoint.
Update API docs.
Change error format to closer resemble our standard error format.

Merge pull request #7603 from 4teamwork/lg/CA-4726/copy-dossier-to-workspace

Add backend support to copy subdossiers to teamraum
